indications: doxazosin alpha 1 adrenergic antagonist indicated : • signs symptoms benign prostatic hyperplasia ( bph ) • treatment hypertension
contraindications: • treatment bph : initiate therapy 1 mg daily . dose maybe titrated 1 2-week intervals , 8 mg daily . ( 2.2 ) • treatment hypertension : initiate therapy 1 mg daily . dose may titrated needed , 16 mg daily . ( 2.3 )

ingredients.name: SODIUM STARCH GLYCOLATE TYPE A POTATO

indications_original: Doxazosin is an alpha 1 adrenergic antagonist indicated for: • Signs and symptoms of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) • Treatment of Hypertension
contraindications_original: • For the treatment of BPH: Initiate therapy at 1 mg once daily. Dose maybe titrated at 1 to 2-week intervals, up to 8 mg once daily. ( 2.2 ) • For the treatment hypertension: Initiate therapy at 1 mg once daily. Dose may be titrated as needed, up to 16 mg once daily. ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Doxazosin is available as tablets for oral administration. Each tablet contains Doxazosin mesylate equivalent to 1 mg (white), 2 mg (yellow or white), 4 mg (orange or white) or 8 mg (green or white) of doxazosin as the free base.

adverseReactions_original: The use of Doxazosin tablet is contraindicated in patients with a hypersensitivity to doxazosin, other quinazolines (e.g., prazosin, terazosin), or any of its components.
